title: 6 Simple Ways to Make Toast Without a Toaster

steps.title: Heat 1 tbsp of olive oil or butter in a pan over medium heat.
steps.content: Heat 1 tbsp of olive oil or butter in a pan over medium heat. Place a medium-sized non-stick pan or a cast iron skillet on your stove over medium heat. Then, add 1 tbsp (15 ml) of olive oil or 1 tbsp (14 g) of butter to the pan and let it heat up for 1 minute. [1] X Research source The olive oil is fully heated when it moves quickly around the pan and starts to shimmer. The butter is ready when it’s fully melted. Feel free to use a different oil in place of olive oil, like coconut, sesame, avocado, or sunflower seed oil. Alternatively, spread soft, room-temperature butter on both sides of your bread instead of adding it directly to the pan. Note : This step is optional. Feel free to skip it if you don’t want to toast your bread in oil or butter.

steps.title: Place the bread in the pan and cook it for about 2 minutes.
steps.content: Place the bread in the pan and cook it for about 2 minutes. Rub the bread into the oil or butter in the pan to ensure it’s nicely coated. Then, gently press it down with a spatula to ensure it toasts evenly. Toast the bread for about 2 minutes, or until the bottom side is crispy and looks golden. [2] X Research source Lift up one corner about every 30 seconds to ensure the bread is cooking to your liking. If your stovetop runs hot or you don’t want your toast to be super crispy, turn down the heat to low. To speed up the toasting process, cover the pan with a lid to trap the heat. Any sort of bread is delicious to toast. For instance, use sandwich bread, a baguette, or ciabatta.

steps.title: Flip the bread over and cook it for another 2 minutes.
steps.content: Flip the bread over and cook it for another 2 minutes. Use a spatula to flip the bread over so the other side gets toasty. Just cook the other side for about 2 minutes, checking on it every 30 seconds, until it is a crispy, golden brown color. [3] X Research source Add a bit more oil or butter to the pan if the first side of the bread absorbed it all.

steps.title: Top the toast with your favorite toppings.
steps.content: Top the toast with your favorite toppings. Transfer your toast to a plate and spread on a tasty topping. For instance, coat it with peanut butter, jam, or cream cheese, rub it with a clove of garlic, or cook a fried egg on top. Or, enjoy your delicious toast plain! [4] X Research source

steps.title: Move an oven rack to the topmost rung.
steps.content: Move an oven rack to the topmost rung. Your oven’s broiler is located at the top of the oven. Simply move a rack to the topmost rung to ensure the bread is as close to the broiler as possible. [5] X Research source This toasting option is great for quickly making multiple slices of toast at once.

steps.title: Set the broiler to high and let your oven preheat.
steps.content: Set the broiler to high and let your oven preheat. Most ovens have a “Broil” button that has a “High” and “Low” option. Simply press “Broil,” select “High,” and start your oven. Then, give the broiler about 1 to 2 minutes to heat up. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Put the bread on a baking sheet and watch it cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
steps.content: Put the bread on a baking sheet and watch it cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Set the slices of bread in a single layer on an ungreased baking sheet. Then, put it on the top rack so it’s closest to the broiler. Let the bread toast until it’s golden brown, watching it closely so it doesn’t burn. [7] X Research source If you don’t have a baking sheet, carefully place the bread directly onto the oven rack. [8] X Research source Optional step : Spread oil or butter onto the bread before placing it in the oven.

steps.title: Flip the bread and toast the other side for 1 to 2 minutes.
steps.content: Flip the bread and toast the other side for 1 to 2 minutes. Put on some oven mitts and take the baking sheet out of the oven. Then, use tongs or a spatula to flip over the bread and put the sheet back in the oven. Keep a close eye on the bread and pull it out when it’s a crispy, golden color. [9] X Research source Plate your toast and put on your favorite toppings when it’s done. For instance, add butter, mashed avocado, peanut butter and bananas, or hummus.

steps.title: Set your oven to 350° F (177° C) and put the bread on a baking sheet.
steps.content: Set your oven to 350° F (177° C) and put the bread on a baking sheet. Preheat your oven to a lower temperature setting around 350° F (177° C). While your oven heats up, arrange your bread in a single layer on an ungreased baking sheet. [10] X Research source This is a slower alternative to using your oven’s broiler. It’s also another great option for making a large batch of toast . Optional step : Coat the bread with oil or butter.

steps.title: Set the bread on the middle rack and cook it for 5 minutes.
steps.content: Set the bread on the middle rack and cook it for 5 minutes. Slide the baking sheet onto the middle rack in the oven. Then, leave the bread in the oven for about 4 to 6 minutes, or until it is a crispy, golden brown. [11] X Research source Watch the bread closely as it cooks to ensure it doesn’t burn.

steps.title: Flip the bread over and cook it for 5 more minutes.
steps.content: Flip the bread over and cook it for 5 more minutes. Use tongs or a spatula to flip the slices of bread onto the other side. Simply cook the other side of the bread until it looks golden, too. Then, take the toast out of the oven. [12] X Research source Spread peanut butter, Nutella, or cinnamon and sugar on your bread for a classic toast treat. If you want to get a little more creative, top your toast with fig jam, goat cheese, and walnuts. Or, add hummus and an olive tapenade. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Heat your air fryer to 400° F (204° C).
steps.content: Heat your air fryer to 400° F (204° C). Turn on your air fryer and set the temperature to 400°F (204° C). Then, wait for the machine to heat up. [14] X Research source Using an air fryer is a convenient alternative to using your oven if you don’t need to make a lot of toast.

steps.title: Place your bread in the basket.
steps.content: Place your bread in the basket. Set your slices of bread directly in the air fryer basket, making sure they lay in a single layer without touching each other. Then, insert the basket into the air fryer. [15] X Research source Optional step : Spread butter or olive oil onto the bread before putting it in the basket.

steps.title: Cook the bread for 3 to 4 minutes, or until golden brown.
steps.content: Cook the bread for 3 to 4 minutes, or until golden brown. Set a timer for 3 to 4 minutes and let the bread toast and crisp up. Then, remove it from the air fryer and apply your favorite toppings. [16] X Research source Optional step : Flip the bread halfway through the cooking time to ensure both sides are toasted.

steps.title: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
steps.content: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Making toast on the grill gives your bread a delicious char and smokey flavor. Simply set your grill to medium-high, which is around 400° F (204° C). [17] X Research source This is a great option if you’re making a lot of toast or already using your grill to cook.

steps.title: Place the bread on the grill and cook it for 1 to 2 minutes.
steps.content: Place the bread on the grill and cook it for 1 to 2 minutes. Once your grill is hot, use a pair of tongs to set the bread directly on the grates. Leave the bread on the grill for about 1 to 2 minutes, or until it starts to brown and develop grill marks. [18] X Research source Watch the bread as it cooks to ensure it doesn’t burn or get too charred for your liking. Optional step : Brush one or both sides of the bread with olive oil to infuse it with more flavor.

steps.title: Flip the bread over and cook the other side for 1 to 2 minutes.
steps.content: Flip the bread over and cook the other side for 1 to 2 minutes. Grab your pair of tongs and turn the bread over so the other side faces the grates. Let the other side toast up until it develops golden grill marks. Then, take the toast off the grill. [19] X Research source Add classic spreads on top of your toast like butter, garlic, peanut butter, Nutella or marshmallow fluff. Or, top it with grilled fruit or bruschetta.

steps.title: Start a fire
steps.content: Start a fire in a safe place. If you don’t have a fire pit, pick a spot to build your fire that isn’t near grass, roots, or low-hanging branches. Place some big rocks in a circle to contain the fire area. Then, lay tinder, like paper strips and leaves, on the ground. Prop kindling, like twigs or cardboard, over the tinder in a triangular shape. Light the tinder with a lighter and blow on it softly until it catches and spreads. [20] X Research source As the fire grows, add small and large logs. If you struggle to keep the fire going and growing, light several different pieces of kindling and tinder at the same time.

steps.title: Put a grill rack and cast iron skillet over the fire.
steps.content: Put a grill rack and cast iron skillet over the fire. Carefully place a grill rack in a stable position over the fire. Then, set a medium or large cast iron skillet on top of the grill rack to heat up. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Place the bread in the skillet and flip it until each side is browned.
steps.content: Place the bread in the skillet and flip it until each side is browned. Campfires can be a little less predictable than stoves, ovens, or grills. So, use tongs to flip the bread every 20 to 30 seconds to see how quickly it’s toasting. When each side is a golden brown, remove the bread from the skillet. [22] X Research source Optional step : Add more flavor to your toast by melting butter in the skillet. Or, add olive oil or bacon grease to the pan.

steps.title: Put out the campfire when you’re done using it.
steps.content: Put out the campfire when you’re done using it. Fill a bucket with water and dump it onto the fire to put it out. Stir the kindling with a stick while you do this to ensure all the embers are wet. It’s safe to leave the area once the ash is cool to the touch and you no longer hear a “hissing” sound. [23] X Research source Alternatively, put out the fire by covering it with dirt or sand.
